Violation_Type: Failure to meet physical residency requirement
Legal_Issue: Whether the respondent met the residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Respondent was physically present in Canada for only 406 days over four years; maintained primary residence and employment in Hong Kong
Remedy_Requested: Overturn the Citizenship Judge's approval of citizenship application
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absences from Canada due to full-time employment abroad; life centered in Hong Kong
Grounds_for_Claim: Non-compliance with statutory residency requirement of 1,095 days
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, travel patterns, center of life, passive indicia (tax returns, leases)
Procedural_Issue: Hearing conducted via videoconference; respondent failed to appear twice
Evidence_Used: Travel records, tax returns, lease agreements, employment records
Evidence_Assessed: Passive indicia deemed insufficient to establish residency
Relief_Sought: Rejection of citizenship application based on failure to meet residency criteria
Governing_Rule: Applicant must be physically present in Canada for at least 1,095 days in the four years preceding application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient evidence to demonstrate actual residency in Canada
Harm_Assessment: Undermining integrity of citizenship process through non-compliant approvals
Cause_Description: Minister appealed Citizenship Judge’s approval of respondent’s application due to failure to meet legal residency requirement
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed documentary evidence and travel history; applied Koo test for residency
Evidence_Issues: Reliance on passive indicia without corroboration of physical presence
Residency_Compliance: Not met – only 406 days of physical presence
Evidence_Assessment: Travel patterns indicate residence outside Canada; domestic ties insufficient to overcome absence
Decision_Rationale: Citizenship Judge erred in fact and law by accepting inadequate proof of residency
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient documentation proving physical presence and residential intent
